qas.question: Near what body of water is St. John's located by?
How many Square miles is St. John's?
In what providence is Edmonton located?
What is the largest Atlantic Province city?
St. Johns is in the northeast of what province?
What is the most easterly city in the Americas?
What city is London, England closer to than St. Johns?
What french city is 3,636 miles from St. Johns?

context: <b5_0>St. John's<b5_0/> is located along the coast of the <a0_0>Atlantic Ocean<a0_0/>, on the northeast of the Avalon Peninsula in southeast <b4_0>Newfoundland<b4_0/>. The city covers an area of 446.04 square kilometres (<a1_0>172.22<a1_0/> sq mi) and is the most easterly city in North America, excluding Greenland; it is 295 miles (475 km) closer to London, England than it is to <b6_0>Edmonton, <a2_0>Alberta<b6_0/><a2_0/>. The city of St. John's is located at a distance by air of 3,636 kilometres (2,259 mi) from <b7_0>Lorient, France<b7_0/> which lies on a nearly precisely identical latitude across the Atlantic on the French western coast. The city is the largest in the province and the second largest in the Atlantic Provinces after <a3_0>Halifax<a3_0/>, Nova Scotia. Its downtown area lies to the west and north of St. John's Harbour, and the rest of the city expands from the downtown to the north, south, east and west.
